page.title: 10HARTSHILL HAYES COUNTRY PARK
page.content: {Hartshill Hayes Country Park covers an area of 136 acres of{Hilltop and{Woodland. }The Hilltop is grazed by cattle as grass cutting is difficult and expensive. {St Lawrence's Wood}is a mixture of mainly{Sycamore}and{Pine}trees, with bracken and bramble covering most of the ground. The Wood is named after a small Chapel which stood here in the 10th Cent. The{Hayes Wood}is mainly mixed woodland and covers an area of 114 acres. It is very old woodland having been there since the 13th Cent. There is a great variety of trees -{Lime, {Larch,Birch,Hazel,Rowan and Oak trees. The timber from the coppiced Limes is used by{Atherstone Hat Makers}to make moulds for felt hats.
